message_1:
Consider the topological space X = {a, b, c, d} with topology T = {{}, {a, b}, {c, d}, {a, b, c, d}}. 
Find out whether the subset A = {a, b} is open or not in the given topology.
message_2: The subset A = {a, b} is open in the given topology T, because it is an element of the topology T. Recall that a subset of a topological space is considered open if it is an element of the topology. In this case, A = {a, b} is an element of T, so it is an open set.
